Replies.Reply: So where are you?
You're in some motel room.
Looks like somebody's home.
more than a few days old.
Let's take a look inside.
YOU PAY FOR WHAT YOU DID! YOU BEG FORGIVENESS, THEN YOU PAY!
Beg my forgiveness! Beg my wife's forgiveness before I blow your brains out!
Teddy!
I'm Leonard Shelby, I'm from San Francisco and I'm -
Shut your mouth!
So you're in some motel room...
... you don't know how long you've been there, or how you got there...
Just some anonymous motel room. Won't tell you anything. Nothing in the drawers, but you look anyway.
Nothing except the Gideon Bible.
It's Leonard... like I told you before.
I guess I've told you about my condition.
My car.
You're in a playful mood.
handicap.
It's broken.
I got a lead on a place.
You know it?
I don't remember.
Looks like somebody's home.
Nothing except the Gideon Bible.
notes. But he'd get confused.
I'm sorry... um... ?
Burt, I'm not sure, but I may have asked you to hold my calls -
I think I may have. I'm not good on the phone.
That's the thing. I have this condition.
I have no memory.

No. It's different. I have no short-term memory. I know who I am and all about myself, but since my injury I can't make any new memories. Everything fades. If we talk for too long, I'll forget how we started. I don't know if we've ever met before, and the next time I see you I won't remember this conversation. So if I seem strange or rude, that's probably...
I've told you this before, haven't I?
My wife.
How long have I been here?
So you're holding my calls?
Okay, but this guy's an exception.
Know this guy?
What makes you think he's my friend?
He's not my friend, Burt. But if he calls, or if he turns up here, then you give me a call in my room, okay?
Just this guy.
I hope my condition won't be a problem for you.
Thanks. Lincoln Street?
This guy told me his name was Teddy.
Mr Gammell?
John Gammell?
Leonard hangs up, thinking. He looks at the writing on the back of his hand, then pulls back his sleeve to reveal the words:  "THE FACTS:"
plate.
I found you, you fuck.
Who is this?
that.
So I can't remember talking to you. What did we talk about?
Sammy Jankis. Yeah, I guess I tell people about Sammy to help them understand. Sammy's story helps me understand my own situation.
Sammy Jankis wrote himself endless notes. But he'd get mixed up. I've got a more graceful solution to the memory problem. I'm disciplined and organized.
Me? I gotta reason.
Natalie.
Sorry, I should have explained. You see, I have this condition -
Please call me Leonard. My wife called me Lenny.
So you have information for me?
Yes.
It is tough. Almost impossible. I'm sorry I can't remember you. It's not personal.
You know him?
Then you shouldn't have to ask.
Why?

You can only feel details. Bits and pieces which you didn't bother to put into words. And extreme moments you feel even if you don't want to. Put it together and you get the feel of the person, enough to know how much you miss them, and how much you hate the person who took them away.
Deals?
Sounds perfect? What do I owe you?
Sorry.
Natalie leaves the key and gets up from the table.
Don't remember.
I met Sammy through work.
I had to see through people's bullshit.
language.
I was good. Sammy was my first real challenge.
I'm sorry, I think I'm checked in here, But I've misplaced my key.
I don't see my key.
What?
This isn't my room?
Then why is this my handwriting?
Better tell me what the fuck's going on.
When was I in here?
Why?
So how many rooms am I checked into in this dump?
Well, at least you're being honest about cheating me.
You don't have to be that honest, Burt.
I'm gonna write that down.
What time is it?
I'd just become an investigator when I came across Sammy. Mr Samuel R. Jankis -

The doctors find some possible damaqe to the hippocampus, nothing conclusive. But Sammy can't remember anything for more than a couple minutes. He can't work, can't do shit, medical bills pile up, his wife calls the insurance company and I get sent in.
My first big claims investigation - I really check into it. Sammy can think just fine, but he can't make any new memories, he can only remember things for a few minutes.

The doctors assure me that there's a real condition called Korsokoff's syndrome; short-term memory loss, rare but legit. But every time I see him I catch a look of recognition. Just a slight look, but he says he can't remember me at all.
actor. Now I'm suspicious and I order more tests.
His wife has to do everything. Sammy can only do simple stuff. He couldn't pick up any new skills at all, and that's how I got him.
Unfinished business. What made you think I wasn't coming back?
Things change.
Guess I've told you about my condition.
It's my condition. I never know if I've already eaten, so I always just eat small amounts.
It's weird, but if you don't eat for a while then your body stops being hungry.
Who?
Why?
Yeah, well I go on facts, not recommendations, okay?
Why?
Memory's unreliable.

No, really. Memory's not perfect. It's not even that good. Ask the police, eyewitness testimony is unreliable. The cops don't catch a killer by sitting around remembering stuff. They collect facts, make notes, draw conclusions.
He took away the woman I love and he took away my memory. He destroyed everything; my life and my ability to live.
Just for revenge. That's what keeps me going. It's all I have.
Discount Inn. Don't know what room; haven't got my key.
I'm sorry, I think I'm checked in here, but I've misplaced my key.

So Sammy can't learn any new skills. But I find something in my research: Conditioning. Sammy should still be able to learn through repetition. It's how you learn stuff like riding a bike, things you don't think about, you just get better through practice. Call it muscle memory, whatever, but it's a completely different part of the brain from the short-term memory. So I have the doctors test Sammy's response to conditioning...
Some of the objects were electrified, They'd give him a small shock.
They kept repeating the test, always with the same objects electrified. The point was to see if he could learn to avoid the electrified objects. Not by memory, but by instinct.
Sorry. It's only me.
Yeah. You?
Useful. You never write a phone number on your hand?
It's great that you would... that you're helping me like this...
I'm sorry.
They kept testing Sammy for months, always with the same objects carrying the electrical charge...

Even with total short-term memory loss, Sammy should've learned to instinctively stop picking up the wrong objects. All previous cases of short-term memory loss had responded to conditioning in some way. Sammy didn't respond at all.
It was enough to suggest his condition was psychological not physical.
We turned down his claim on the grounds that he wasn't covered for mental illness. Sammy's wife got stuck with the bills and I got a promotion for rejecting a big claim.
Conditioning didn't work for Sammy, so he became helpless. But it works for me.
Natalie, right?
Who the fuck is Dodd?
Who is he? What have you got me into?
That's the problem! How can I find John G. when I don't know what's going on?!
How do I know he did that to you?
So I just take your word?
Something feels wrong. I think someone's fucking with me. Trying to get me to kill the wrong guy.
What?
Course not.
You have to burn them.
There are things you know for sure.
I know the feel of the world.
I know how this wood will sound when I knock.
I know how this glass will feel when I pick it up.
Certainties. You think it's knowledge, but it's a kind of memory, a kind you take for granted. I can remember so much.
and I know her.
She's gone and the present is trivia, which I can scribble down as notes.
It's not easy to be calm when -
I'm sorry.
What happened?
Who did he go to meet?
What do the police think?
Kill him.
Natalie's eyes are open.
to be able to let her go. I don't want to wake up every morning thinking she's still here then realizing that she's not.
Sammy's wife was crippled by the cost of supporting him and fighting the company's decision - but it wasn't the money that got to her.

I never said that Sammy was faking. Just that his problem was mental, not physical. But she... she couldn't understand. She looks into his eyes and sees the same person. And if it's not a physical problem...
So good old Leonard Shelby from the insurance company gives her the seed of doubt, just like he gave it to the doctors. But I never said that Sammy was faking. I never said that.
Awake.
Just a minute!
Teddy!
Why are you here?
You don't know him?
I don't think so.
I might have fallen asleep before I did.
What's your name?
Your name.
Who did this to you?
Who did this to you?
No. No, just let me think for a minute.
Here we go.
Why?
We've got to get him out of here.
We can't just walk him out tied up and bleeding.
I don't know.
Yes I do... this isn't my room.
It must be his. I don't think they'd let someone like me carry a gun.
Which one?
Shut it, Teddy.
I'll ride with him. You follow.
Take your own car.
Yeah. I think it was your sinister mustache that got him.
What's wrong with this one?
I'm gonna ask Natalie what the fuck that was all about.
Natalie, right?
Who the fuck is Dodd?
What Mrs. Jankis didn't understand was that you can't bully someone into remembering... the more pressure you're under, the harder it gets.
Then call me back.
Don't feel drunk.
Not just now!
Leonard looks at the note.
I'm at the MOUNTCREST INN on 5th Street, Room 6, and I need you to come over as soon as you get this, it's important.
I'll get the jump on you, fucker.
Is this the guy?
Fuck! Sorry.
Need a weapon.
What the fuck am I doing?
Don't be too hard on yourself.
Seat belt.
How can you read that again?
It's good.
You've read it a hundred times.
Yeah, but the pleasure of a book is in wanting to know what happens next -
Don't be a prick. I'm not reading it to annoy you, I enjoy it. Just let me read, please.
Probably tried this before. Probably burned truckloads of your stuff. Can't remember to forget you.
Do I know this guy?
He seems to know me.
What the fuck!
Thanks.
Interested in buying one?
I forget.
I wouldn't be too hard on yourself.
Who is this?
Honey?
Honey? It's late.
Everything okay?
Are you okay in there?!
No. That would have been worse.
I'd like you to leave now.
and STUFFING them into the bag.
Replies.Didascalie: (cont'd) (the paperback book, hairbrush, alarm clock, stuffed toy)

Replies.Reply: Well, sir, that would certainly be in keeping with some of my own discoveries.
The police report mentioned the drugs found in the car outside my house. The car was stolen, but his prints were all over it, along with some of his stuff.
It has lots of information, but with my condition, it's tough. I can't really keep it all in mind at once.
Yeah, and there's pages missing... I guess I've been trying to log them all.

The police gave me the report themselves. I dealt with them a lot in my insurance job, and I had friends in the department. They must have figured that if I saw the facts of the case, then I would stop believing that we needed to find John G.
They weren't even looking for John G.
None? Okay, blonde. Yeah, blonde is fine.
It's simple, you just go to the bathroom.
No, you just go into the bathroom. We go to bed, you wait till I fall asleep, then you go into the bathroom and slam the door.
Just loud enough to wake me up.
That's it.
But, first I need you to put these things around.
Just pretend these things are yours, and this is your bedroom.
No. Just leave the stuff lying around as if it were yours. Like you just took it off or something.
No! No, don't use it, you, I mean it's...
The drugs stashed in the car doesn't ring true for me.
The police figure the guy was an addict needing money to score, but I'm not convinced. He's not gonna be breaking in when he's still got a stash that big.
I think John G. left it or planted it.
Well, it was a lot for one guy's personal use.
How do you know that?
Right, that's true. It fits.
Too much for personal use, so he deals.
Who the fuck are you?
Prove it.
What are you doing in my car?
Unfinished business.
Who's she?
Why's that?
What do you mean "bad news"?
Why should I care?
From who?
Yeah, well maybe she'll make it you. Is that it? You worried she'll use me against you?
Why not?
Why are you following me?
Happy now?
Why?
What sort of questions?
Like what?
I have money.
My wife's death. I used to work in Insurance, we were well covered.
Yes, I do. I don't have amnesia. I remember everything about myself up until the incident. I'm Leonard Shelby, I'm from San Fran -
I didn't sell -
Yeah, well, thanks for the advice.
Fuck it. I need my own place.
I can't blame the cops for not taking me seriously. This is a difficult condition for people to understand. I mean look at Sammy Jankis. His own wife couldn't deal with it.
I told you about how she tried to get him to snap out of it?
It got much worse than that. Eventually Sammy's wife came to see me at the office, and I found out all kinds of shit.
She knew that I was the one who had built he case for Sammy faking it.

She told me about life with Sammy, how she'd treated him. It had got to the point where she'd get Sammy to hide food all around the house, then stop feeding him to see if his hunger would make him remember where he'd hidden the stuff.
Mrs. Jankis, the company's position isn't that Sammy is "faking" anything, just that his condition can't be shown -
We shouldn't even be talking this way while the case is still open to appeal.
Then why are you here?
Mrs. Jankis, what do you want from me?
I believe that Sammy should be physically capable of making new memories.
She seemed to leave happy. I thought I'd helped her.
I thought she just needed some kind of answer.
I didn't think it was important to her what the answer was, just that she had one to believe.
What happened?
Who?
Why?
Calm down.
Take it easy. You're safe now. You're safe.
Let's get some ice on your face.
And what did he say?
Where is he?
I'll go see him.
Give him some bruises of his own and tell him to look for a guy called Teddy.
My wife used to call me Lenny.
Yeah, I hated it.
I'll take care of it. Just tell me what he looks like, and where I can find him.
Me? Why would he be interested in me?
Why would you do that?
No, she shouldn't have given me that responsibility. Shit, I'm not a doctor, I'm a claims investigator.
I suppose, but I've got all sorts of other considerations.
Legal responsibility, and large financial...
Who is this?
What's wrong?
Who?
What does he want?
Did you?
What's this all about?
I have this condition -
What happened?
Neither do I.
I'm not.
How?
What?
What do you think I am?! I'm not gonna kill someone for money.
That's different.
Don't talk about my wife.
Calm down.
Just take it easy, this isn't my fault.
Yes.
Shut the fuck up!
Don't say another fucking word!
What happened?
They're not looking for him.
They don't think he exists.
I told them what I remembered. I was asleep, something woke me up...
out of bed for a while.
the police didn't believe me.
Thank you.
Oh, one thing.
Something to remember you by.
What's wrong?
Yeah?
That's right I did, didn't I?
A cop?
tankard with beer, brings it over and sets it in front of Leonard, smiling.
Thanks.
Nobody's perfect.
My wife.
Dying.
I remember my wife dying.
Beer, please.
A BEER, please.
There's a dress code?
I'm meeting someone called Natalie.
Oh. But haven't we met before?
So why am I here?
How do you know about me?
Who's your boyfriend?
term memory loss.
I don't know.
I don't know. I'm sorry.
fades, nothing sticks. By the time we finish this conversation I won't remember how it started, and the next time I see you I won't know that I've ever met you before.
Found it in my pocket.
Thank-you.
Mrs. Jankis is seated across the desk from Leonard. She gets up to leave. Leonard just sits there.
I never said he was faking. Just that his condition was mental, not physical.
She knew beyond doubt that he loved her, so she found a way to test him.
She really thought she would call his bluff...
He's been in a home ever since. He doesn't even know his wife is dead.
Didn't know this town had a parlor.
I'd like this on my thigh please.
Promise you won't call me an idiot.
How'd you know I was in here?
Guess I wanted to get something down before it slipped my mind.
It'll be alright for a minute.
Why?
Why not?
How do you know this?
How do you know him?
Who?
Sneaky fuck. "Bad Cop". Had me going.
Officer Gammell.
Something to remember you by.
I'm sorry - is it Officer, or Lieutenant Gammell?
You're not coming?
Jimmy?
Do you remember me?
Strip!
Don't say anything else.
Quiet!
Pants, too.
I don't want blood on them.
Strip!
You think you can bargain with me?!
I don't want your fucking money!
I want my fucking life back!
Hey! Mister! I need help!
There's a guy in here, hurt bad! We gotta get him to a doctor!
He might have fallen down the stairs, I don't know, I don't know what's going on, I'm confused. I have this memory thing -
Maybe. Maybe just.
I don't know. See, I have this condition.
Remember me again, huh?
This is a drug deal?!
You're using me!
What the fuck are you talking about?
That's Sammy, not me! I told you about Sammy -
I never said he was faking! I never said that!
I was wrong! That's the whole point!
My wife wasn't diabetic.
Yes, I will.
Somehow, I'll know!
When it's done, I'll know! It'll be different!
Your name's Teddy.
I'm not a killer...
It is now.
Why not?
I'd rather be mistaken for a dead guy than a murderer. I'm gonna hang on to this.

I have to believe in the world outside my own mind. I have to believe that my actions still have meaning, even if I can't remember them. I have to believe that when my eyes are closed, the world's still there.
That thing's been here for years.
Find anything? Didn't think so, let's go, yeah?
Fuck this.
You don't have a clue, you freak.
Leonard, you don't have a clue what's going on. You don't even know my name.
You read it off your fucking photo. You don't know me, you don't even know who you are.
That's who you were, you don't know who you are.
Lemme take you down in the basement and show you what you've become.
C'mon, Lenny - we'll take a look down there together. Then you'll know. You'll know what you really are.
Lenny!
Only every time I see ya!
This is your car.
Just trying to have a little fun.
Roll your window up, will ya?
I can get that fixed for you.
So where are we going, Sherlock?
What the hell you want to go there for?
Why are we going there?
Yup?
Lenny, is that you?
Lenny, it's Teddy. Look, stay there, okay? I'm gonna be right over.
Lenny! I thought you'd gone for good.
You said you were leaving town.
So I see. It's good to see you. My name's Teddy.
Only every time I see ya! Come on, I'll buy you lunch.
Not hungry?
You don't have to remember to be hungry.
Yeah, yeah. I heard enough about him.
The guy you're looking for, Johnny G.
Leonard, you need to be very careful.
Well, the other day you made it sound like you thought somebody might be trying to set you up. Get you to kill the wrong guy.
Lenny, you can't trust a man's life to your little notes and pictures.
Because you're relying on them alone. You Don't remember what you've discovered or how. Your notes might be unreliable.
You really want to find this guy?
You're living.
We'll find him. Where are you staying?
Probably left it in your room.
Lenny! I thought you'd gone for good.
Finished playing with yourself, Lenny?
I get it - amorous neighbors.
You called me. You wanted my help. You know, Lenny, I've had more rewarding friendships than this one. Although I do get to keep using the same jokes.
Who the fuck is that?
No! Should I?
Is this John G.?
Think so? You don't know? Didn't you write it down?
Ask him.
I'm not gonna help you kill this guy, if that's what -
Natalie? Natalie who?
I think I know her.
He's got to have a car, right? We just take him back to his car and tell him to get the fuck out of town before we kill him.
How'd ya get him in here in the first place?
Why would I have a gun?
Fucking hope not.
We probably ought to take his car, you know, teach him a lesson.
Easy for you to say, you've got the Jag.
Give me your keys.
So was he scared?
Fuck you. We shoulda taken his car.
You like it? Let's trade.
So what are you gonna do now?
Natalie who?
You know what to do.
You should lock a car as nice as this.
Teddy. Your buddy.
Sammy. Remember Sammy. You told me about Sammy.
Sense of humour went with the memory, huh? You know why you're still here, don't you?
Lenny, as a buddy, let me inform you.
Whose house do you think you just walked out of?
Take a look at your pictures, I bet you got one of her.
Great shot, Lenny.
You wanna make a note that you can't trust her.
Because she'll have taken one look at your clothes and your car and started thinking of ways to turn the situation to her advantage. She's already got you staying with her, for fuck's sake.
You can't stay with her. Let me give you the name of a motel.
Good thing I found you. She's bad news.
She's involved with these drug dealers.
See these? That's the bar where she works. Her boyfriend's a drug dealer.
She's gonna use you. To protect herself.
Guys who'll come after her. Guys who'll want to know what happened to her boyfriend. They'll want to make somebody pay. Maybe she'll try and make it you.
She couldn't.
She has no idea who I am.

I'm trying to help you. I knew she'd get her claws into you. She doesn't know anything about your investigation, so when she offers to help you, it'll be for her own reasons. Why would I lie? Do not go back to her. Take out a pen, write yourself a note, do not trust her.
I won't be happy until you leave town.
How long do you think you can hang around here before people start asking questions?
The sort of questions you should be asking yourself.
Like how'd you get this car? That suit?
From what?
So in your grief you wandered into a Jaguar dealership?
You haven't got a clue, have you? You don't even know who you are?
That's who you were, Lenny. You don't know who you are, who you've become since the incident. You're wandering around, playing detective... and you don't even know how long ago it was.
Leonard looks down at his suit, then back to Teddy.
I know, you investigated. Maybe you need to apply some of your investigative skills to yourself.
Don't go back in there. There's a motel out of town.
It's been fun, Lenny.
You should lock a car as nice as this.
Hi, Lenny.
It's alright, we know each other, right, Lenny?
The Jaguar's out front. You didn't even Bother to put it around back.
You should have just left town, Lenny.
Gimme the keys, I'll move the car.
Lenny, I'll be back in a minute. I've got to get you some stuff.
Give us a minute, will ya?
Why? Come on, Leonard, we talked about this. It's not safe f or you to be walking around like this.
need to get you a change of identity.
'Cos he fucking told me. He thinks it's funny. He's laughing at you.
I'm a snitch. He's a cop from out of town looking for information. The local boys put us in touch.
Leonard heads back into the curtained cubicle with the plastic bag of clothes.
Lenny!
Just Teddy. Don't write Gammell please.
I'm undercover. Here's directions. He'll be heading there now.
Leonard climbs into the truck. Teddy taps on the window.
Leonard?
Make him beg.
What's wrong?
No. Don't worry, I'm a cop. Everything'll be okay. Is he still breathing?
So what were you doing here?
Well, I hope it's not as serious as his, 'cos this guy's dead.
I think you've got the wrong idea -
A load of amphetamine I told him I had.
No!

You tell everyone about Sammy. Everyone who'll listen. "Remember Sammy Jankis, remember Sammy Jankis". Great story. Gets better every time you tell it. So you lie to yourself to be happy. Nothing wrong with that - we all do. Who cares if there's a few little things you'd rather not remember?
I dunno... your wife surviving the assault... her not believing about your condition... the doubt tearing her up inside.., the insulin -
Like you've told yourself. Over and over.
Sammy was a con man. A faker.
You exposed him for what he was: a fraud.
Sammy didn't have a wife.
It was your wife who had diabetes.
Are you sure?
Jimmy down there.
No, you won't.
You won't remember!
Beat. Leonard looks at Teddy, questioning.
killed him.
MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99 115A.
you already killed.
I've never seen you so happy - I was convinced you'd remember. But it didn't stick, like nothing ever sticks. Like this won't stick.
that face again.
guys called James G? Or John G? Shit, Leonard, I'm a John G.
MEMENTO - Green Revisions 10-4-99 116A.
It's beer o'clock. And I'm buying. Our work here is done.
Hey! Hey, that's not your car!
You can't just take it!
You just killed the guy who owned it!
That guy's here already.
Hiya.
What can I do for you, Leonard?
Burt.
You don't know?
You said you like to look people in the eye when you talk to them. Don't you remember?
Condition?
Amnesia?
I don't mean to mess with you. It's just so weird. You don't remember me at all, and we talked a bunch of times.
What's the last thing you remember?
What's it like?
Couple days.
As requested.
Your friend, right?
Seen you together, that's all.
Sure. But nobody else, right?
Not if you remember to pay your bill.
That guy's here already.
Hi, Leonard.
Probably in the room.
Shit. Wrong room.
No, let's go.
This was your room. You're up in 304 now.
Last week. Then I rented you another one On top of this.
Business is slow. I told my boss about You, about your condition. He told me to Try and rent you another room.
You're still paying for it. It's still Your room.
Leonard walks out past Burt.
Yeah, well you're not gonna remember, anyway.
Leonard.
Always get a receipt.
Hi, Leonard.
Leonard, it's Burt from the front desk.
I know you said you didn't want any calls...
Yeah, but there's a call for you from this guy. He's a cop.
Sir? You left these at your table.
You wanna go east on sixth.
Just keep straight, all the way out of town, then take a right.
You don't remember me.
You did explain, Lenny.
You told me.
Yeah.
Is that what your little note says?
Must be tough living life according to a few scraps of paper. Mix up your laundry list and your grocery list, you'll be eating your underwear.
But I guess that's why you got those freaky tattoos.
I'm sorry.
I do have information for you. You gave me a license plate number? I had my friend at the DMV trace it. Guess what name came up.
No. But the photo on his license looked familiar. I think he's been in the bar before  Natalie slides the envelope towards him, but stops short.
This is a copy of his registration, license, photo and all. Are you sure you want this?
Yes.
But even if you get your revenge, you won't remember it. You won't even know it's happened.
Tell me about her again.
Because you like to remember her. I want to see you enjoy yourself.
Don't just recite the words. Close your eyes, remember her.
I wrote an address in there, too. Might be useful. It's this abandoned place outside of town. I guy I know used to use it for his bigger deals.
It's isolated.
I wasn't helping you for money.
It's not your fault. See, you have this condition...
304? You left this at my place.
They treating you alright?
You know what we have in common?
